eu.fbk.dkm.springles.backend

Interface Backend

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractRepositoryBackend, AbstractSailBackend, DebuggingBackend, ForwardingBackend

    public interface Backend
    Backend abstraction.

    A backend provides access to the Sesame repository or sail object wrapped by a Springles repository, which provides storage and querying capabilities. The backend abstraction defines an API through which different storage implementations can be exploited in Springles. The lifecycle of a backend is articulated in the following phases:

    • Instantiation and configuration, through implementation specific constructor and property setter methods.
    • Initialization, through method initialize(File) that specifies the data directory where the backend can store its data (this is the same data directory the enclosing Springles repository is initialized with and may be null in case of transient repositories).
    • Access to backend properties ( isWritable() and getValueFactory() ) and creation of transactions ( newTransaction(String,boolean) ) through which data in the backend can be read, queried or modified. Note that properties can be accessed only after initialization, as their value may depend on the data directory supplied to initialize(File) .
    • Disposal, through method close() that releases allocated resources. For backend that does not support 'durability' as part of ACID transaction properties (e.g., Sesame memory and native stores under certain configurations), data can be considered safely written to disk only after this method is successfully called.

    Static factory methods in Backends permits to create Backend instances for several common use sail and repository implementations, while abstract classes AbstractRepositoryBackend and AbstractSailBackend can be extended to ease the implementation of this interface.

    Implementations of this class must be thread safe, implementing suitable synchronization mechanism if necessary.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Closes the backend.
      org.openrdf.model.ValueFactory getValueFactory()
      Returns the ValueFactory associated to the backend.
      void initialize(File dataDir)
      Initializes the backend.
      boolean isWritable()
      Specifies whether the backend supports write access (delete / add statements).
      Transaction newTransaction(String id, boolean writable)
      Creates a new transaction manipulating data in the backend.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        void initialize(@Nullable
              File dataDir)
                throws org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException
        Initializes the backend. This method is called to initialize the backend, supplying the data directory where the backend can store its data.
        Parameters:
        dataDir - an optional data directory where the backend can persist its RDF data
        Throws:
        org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException - on failure

      • isWritable

        boolean isWritable()
        Specifies whether the backend supports write access (delete / add statements). This method is called only after the backend is initialized, as the writable status may depend on the data directory supplied at initialization time.
        Returns:
        true if the backend supports write access

      • getValueFactory

        org.openrdf.model.ValueFactory getValueFactory()
        Returns the ValueFactory associated to the backend. This method is called only after the backend is initialized.
        Returns:
        the ValueFactory associated to the backend

      • newTransaction

        Transaction newTransaction(String id,
                         boolean writable)
                           throws org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException
        Creates a new transaction manipulating data in the backend. The returned transaction is not expected to support inference (InferenceMode parameters and closure-related operations are ignored) as well as named queries and update operations (methods Transaction.query(URI, QueryType, InferenceMode, Object...) and Transaction.update(URI, InferenceMode, Object...) are unsupported).
        Parameters:
        id - the ID of the created transaction
        writable - true if the transaction must support read/write access
        Returns:
        the created transaction
        Throws:
        org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException - on failure, including the case a read/write transaction is requested but the backend is read-only

      • close

        void close()
           throws org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException
        Closes the backend. This method is called to close the backend and release the associated resources. For some Backend implementations, properly closing the backend is mandatory in order to avoid data losses (see specific implementation details).
        Throws:
        org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException - on failure
